title: PRC Data Challenge
text:
The Performance Review Commission (PRC) aims at engaging with data scientists, even without Aviation background, to team up and compete to solve a (big-ish) Data Challenge of interest to the wider Aviation community using open data and openly sharing final solutions.
The 2025 edition of the PRC Data Challenge builds on top of the 2024 edition and proposes to build Machine Learning (ML) models to predict the amount of fuel flown at certain intervals of the flight.



PRC Data Challenge


ADD a sort of 3D flight trajectory with portions for the intervals of fuel flown.



List of Acronyms

ML: Machine Learning
PRC: Performance Review Commission

title: 2  Data
text:
Dataset description
We provide:
We use worldwide flights from which to learn and predict the amount of fuel flown in one or more intervals of their airborne portion. This dataset is available in flightlist.csv and contains all flight details for the flights in both the train and test sets.
We consequently provide Automatic Dependent Surveillance–Broadcast (ADS-B) position reports for all flights in the flight list. These flight trajectories are possibly incomplete, i.e. they can lack portions.

title: 2  Data
text:
Overview
The data has been split into two groups:

training set (train.csv)
test set (test.csv)

The training set should be used to build your machine learning models. For the training set, we provide the outcome, the “ground truth”, for all the known intervals of fuel flown amount. Your model will be based on “features” like aircraft type and phase of the flight. You will also use feature engineering to create new features.
The test set should be used to see how well your model performs on unseen data. For the test set, we do not provide the ground truth for the relevant intervals of the flight. It is your job to predict these outcomes. For each interval in a flight in the test set, use the model you trained to predict the amount of fuel flown.

title: 2  Data
text:
Contextual datasets
The following datasets provide essential information to use in the engineering of your model.

Flight list
The following is the list of columns in flightlist.csv:

flight_id: a unique identifier for the flight between Aerodrome of DEParture (ADEP) and Aerodrome of DEStination (ADES)
adep: the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) code of the origin of the flight
ades: the ICAO code of the destination of the flight
takeoff: the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) timestamp of the take-off time
landed: the UTC timestamp of the landing time
icao24: the ICAO 24-bit address of the airframe carrying out the flight
aircraft_type: the ICAO aircraft type code of the aircraft carrying out the flight



Trajectories
We have trajectory files for each flight…JUNZI details?
Each trajectory is described by

longitude: longitude in Decimal degrees (DD) in [-180, 180] range
latitude: latitude in DD in [-90, 90] range
altitude: altitude in feet [ft]
timestamp: timestamp with time zone
groundspeed: ground speed in knots [kt]
track: track angle in DD
track_unwrapped: unwrapped track angle in DD
vertical_rate: vertical rate of climb/descent (vertical_rate [ft/min])

title: 3  About
text:
This website describes the PRC Data Challenge, an initiative by the Performance Review Commission (PRC).
The Performance Review Commission was established in 1998 by EUROCONTROL’s Permanent Commission. It provides objective information and independent advice to EUROCONTROL’s governing bodies on European ATM performance, based on extensive research, data analysis and consultation with stakeholders. Its purpose is “to ensure the effective management of the European air traffic management System through a strong, transparent and independent performance review” (Article 1 of Performance Review Commission 2003).
You can find further details in the AIU Portal PRC page.

References


Performance Review Commission. 2003. “PRC Terms of
Reference and Rules of
Procedure.” EUROCONTROL. https://www.eurocontrol.int/sites/default/files/2021-04/prc-terms-reference-rules-procedure.pdf.






List of Acronyms

PRC: Performance Review Commission
